Articles.Content:
17 hours ago, JorgeCS said:

@themaster401, very glad to see that you have continued Astronomer's work in an amazing way... keep up the good work!! Congrats!

Now, allow me to post my issue... After reading the whole post (due to I had the CKAN problem with Scatterer dependency... so I went back to the manual installation after a deep cleanup and now back to the CKAN installation, after a deep cleanup again), everything looks great. But, the Skybox is missing ingame. I know that if I copy the textures in TextureReplacer/Default, I should have it back. But I think if I do that, both the ones from TR and the ones inside AVP will be loaded into RAM. I'm actually not sure wether this is only happening with my installation or it is the default behavior.

Also, when running the ingame EVE configurator, the first screen is showing TextureConfig - AstronomersVisualPack/EVE/textures, but it shows an 'Invalid name!' and nothing to do there... I'm sorry but I can't post a picture... having problems accessing Imgur from China. Is this normal?

 

Thank you!!

The latest AVP depends on TextureReplacerReplaced rather than the TR 1.3 port due to it's functionality of being able to load textures from other folders, allowing further integration with other mods with all AVP content in a single folder. When the EVE configurator spits out "invalid name", it simply means that since the name box is empty by default it is invalid. If you click on over to the cloud configs and such, the cloud entries will show up in the list which you can select and modify.

Edited September 2, 2017 by themaster401

Hi! I have a tiny problem. all the terrain and steructures are bright at night

Spoiler

 

Edited September 5, 2017 by NotAPickleRick

1 hour ago, NotAPickleRick said:

Hi! I have a tiny problem. all the terrain and steructures are bright at night

  Hide contents

 

Well, that's a new one.

A KSP.log would help, though it would be difficult to find the source of this specific issue. I have never encountered it myself or with any users.

1 hour ago, NotAPickleRick said:

Hi! I have a tiny problem. all the terrain and steructures are bright at night

  Reveal hidden contents

 

Are you sure you didn't raise up the luminosity in the Settings?

21 hours ago, Nansuchao said:

Are you sure you didn't raise up the luminosity in the Settings?

f'n genius, thanks, mate XD

Spoiler

 

Edited September 6, 2017 by NotAPickleRick

Hello. I have some questions!

1. Is that bright object in the sky supposed to be lightning? Sky is literally swarmed with these things, i'd say that's about 30 per second from ground POV, no less. Kerbin, Duna, Laythe - all the same.

 

2. Joolian eclipse watched from Laythe. Something is definitely wrong here (scatterer himself without AVP handles this event as it should). Sky is also swarmed with flashes.

Finally, I was glad to find out that this mod requires TextureReplacerReplaced, but it took some time to figure that out. Shouldn't it be mentioned in the first post?

Update. As I mentioned TRR here, it is important to set "isUnloadingEnabled = never" in @Default.cfg, because leaving it as is may cause many warnings related to unaccessible PNG textures (when using KSPI for example).

Edited September 7, 2017 by chukovskiy

11 minutes ago, chukovskiy said:

Is that bright object in the sky supposed to be lightning? 

Sky is also swarmed with flashes.

Spoiler

@themaster401

Yes, it's supposed lightning. Its been in astronomers pack since WAAAAAY back when. It's a bit funky. 

The ocean issue you see there is a scatterer bug. A scene change can fix this.

Edited September 6, 2017 by Galileo

Thanks for fast reply Galileo! I am not that good in understanding mods, but I'm kinda unsatisfied with "scatterer bug" reason.

Eclipse without EVE/AVP (scatterer only) works just fine. Should AVP/EVE appear, a non-transparent black surface appears in place of stock water surface (seen on my screenshot above).

That black surface appears even with scatterer folder manually cut away from GameData. (and only with AVP, EVE and Squad folders inside). Below is what it looks like. (screenshot is mod-heavy but "water" looks 100% same)

Update: this is directly related to shadows.cfg in AstronomersVisualPack/EVE (and hence to CelestialShadows.dll in EVE)

This has been mentioned about a year ago in EVE thread by the way.

Log: https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B-CeLSG9s3dCSDNDVXRPNjZMSVk

Edited September 7, 2017 by chukovskiy

Hello, and thanks for this mod. Images are gorgeous, and it seems very nice in my game also.

One thing though. Kerbin is so blueyy that I've trouble seeing continents. I've tried a few things but I can't find the reason.

Here is an screenshot : Kerbin

Edited September 7, 2017 by Ikare

1 hour ago, Ikare said:

Hello, and thanks for this mod. Images are gorgeous, and it seems very nice in my game also.

One thing though. Kerbin is so blueyy that I've trouble seeing continents. I've tried a few things but I can't find the reason.

Here is an screenshot : Kerbin

Make sure you have the latest scatterer and only the default scatterer configs. Kerbin shouldn't have angled wispy clouds.

I have scatterer v0.0320, I think it's good. BUT I should have mentionned that I run KSP 1.2.2

I read this thread (ok, not the full 17 pages, but a good part) to know how to install Astronomer's on KSP 1.2.2, but I might have failed somewhere.

With all the parts (EVE, SVE, TextureReplacer, scatterer...) I've always found it difficult to install the visual mods with CKAN, so with the additional complexity of Astronomer's I went for a manual install, but maybe took the wrong package.

I have a simple question which might have a complicated answer. Can I use AVP? (avp with ksprc pref.)

Spoiler

I r dum

Hello and thanks for updating to 1.3! I'm attempting to track down an issue I'm having - I'm positive it doesn't involve AVP but I'm just hoping to get some direction in my searches for a fix!

Spoiler

KSP 1.3, installed AVP and all pre-reqs, using 4k TP, following your excellent install instructions. Everything looks beautiful!

I've noticed sometimes while in orbit that when an eclipse happens, or a mun transit, there's a large black "window" that takes up half my screen. It moves around like it is attached to my ship, and zooming way out will still cause the issue. When my ship is directly between the body and the sun, the effect doesn't happen. It's most pronounced over the day/night line. I can try to take some video if requested but I did manage to get a couple shots:

I tested AVP by itself (with dependencies) and the issue doesn't seem to happen.

I'm going to start removing mods trying to repair it but was hoping maybe you could point me in the right direction! 

Thanks for reading and thank you again for your work on making KSP so incredibly awesome!

 

 

Edited September 16, 2017 by Chimichanga

@themaster401  Thank you so very much for maintaining this incredible piece of work. I just switched for EVE+SVE to AVP and I definetly have a new favourite.
Just a note: It might be a good idea to add the fact that it requires a scatterer reinstall if switching from SVE to the OP. I had that issue and while it was quickly fixed by rummaging through the thread a little it would be even nicer to just know in advance.
Anyways, props to you (and any other contributors) for the great service you are doing our community. o7
